paper_title.ja: 強度の開口障害を伴った不全型ベーチェット病の１例
paper_title.en: A case of incomplete Behcet's disease with severe trismus

description.ja:
Behcet's disease is a systemic, chronic recurrent disease characterized by oral aphtha, genital ulcers, ocular lesions, and arthritic symptoms. Incomplete Behcet's disease lacks these common symptoms. We report a case of incomplete Behcet's disease associated with severe trismus.
The patient was a 39-year-old man. Initially, severe trismus developed, accompanied by swelling of the right cheek anthema-like folliculitis, and pharyngitis. Inflammatory symptoms with fever also occurred.
Treatment for trismus was administered to relieve the main symptoms, and collagen disease specialists conducted medical examinations. Incomplete Behcet's disease was finally diagnosed.
Steroid treatment was extremely effective. After 35 days of steroid treatment, the trismus totally resolved. The anthema-like folliculitis was suggested to be caused by inflammation of the masticatory muscles or temporomandibular joint due to Behcet's disease. It was difficult to diagnose this case as incomplete Behcet's disease.
description.en:
Behcet's disease is a systemic, chronic recurrent disease characterized by oral aphtha, genital ulcers, ocular lesions, and arthritic symptoms. Incomplete Behcet's disease lacks these common symptoms. We report a case of incomplete Behcet's disease associated with severe trismus.
The patient was a 39-year-old man. Initially, severe trismus developed, accompanied by swelling of the right cheek anthema-like folliculitis, and pharyngitis. Inflammatory symptoms with fever also occurred.
Treatment for trismus was administered to relieve the main symptoms, and collagen disease specialists conducted medical examinations. Incomplete Behcet's disease was finally diagnosed.
Steroid treatment was extremely effective. After 35 days of steroid treatment, the trismus totally resolved. The anthema-like folliculitis was suggested to be caused by inflammation of the masticatory muscles or temporomandibular joint due to Behcet's disease. It was difficult to diagnose this case as incomplete Behcet's disease.

paper_title.ja: 鼻口蓋管嚢胞から発生したと考えられた上顎骨中心性癌の１例
paper_title.en: A case of central carcinoma of the maxilla arising from a nasopalatine duct cyst

description.ja:
Malignant tumors rarely arise from jaws cyst. We report a case of squamous cell carcinoma arising from a nasopalatine duct cyst. A 70-year-old man presented with a swelling in the palatal gingiva at the middle of the maxilla. Oral examination showed a 28×25mm swelling with a puncture mark, asmooth surface, and normal color. Radiographic examination revealed a round translucent image measuring 15×12mm in diameter in the middle of maxilla. The image was clearly demarcated. Under general anesthesia, extirpation of the cyst was performed for a diagnosis of nasopalatine canal cyst. Histopathological examination of the resected specimens showed transition of histologically normal cystic epithelium to squamous cell carcinoma. After the first operation, partial resection of the maxilla was performed. Three months after the partial resection, left jugular lymph node metastasis was detected. Partial neck dissection, chemotherapy, and irradiation were performed. Twelve months after partial resection of the maxilla, right jugular lymph node metastasis was found. Radical neck dissection was performed.
For 2 years 4 months, there was no disease recurrence. However, the patient died due of pneumonia on April 13, 2002.
description.en:
Malignant tumors rarely arise from jaws cyst. We report a case of squamous cell carcinoma arising from a nasopalatine duct cyst. A 70-year-old man presented with a swelling in the palatal gingiva at the middle of the maxilla. Oral examination showed a 28×25mm swelling with a puncture mark, asmooth surface, and normal color. Radiographic examination revealed a round translucent image measuring 15×12mm in diameter in the middle of maxilla. The image was clearly demarcated. Under general anesthesia, extirpation of the cyst was performed for a diagnosis of nasopalatine canal cyst. Histopathological examination of the resected specimens showed transition of histologically normal cystic epithelium to squamous cell carcinoma. After the first operation, partial resection of the maxilla was performed. Three months after the partial resection, left jugular lymph node metastasis was detected. Partial neck dissection, chemotherapy, and irradiation were performed. Twelve months after partial resection of the maxilla, right jugular lymph node metastasis was found. Radical neck dissection was performed.
For 2 years 4 months, there was no disease recurrence. However, the patient died due of pneumonia on April 13, 2002.

Nedaplatin 動注時の投与量計算式に関する検討
舌にみられた骨性分離腫の１例
paper_title.en: A Case of Osseous Choristoma of the Tongue

description.ja:
A case of osseous choristoma of the tongue was reported. This disorder seems to be rare. The patient was a 14 year-old girl who had been referred to our clinic in June of 2000. For several years she had been aware of a small tumor in the dorsal of posterior of her tongue. However, the tumor had showed no other symptoms and no rapid growing. We diagnosed that it might be a benign tumor of the tongue. We continued to follow the tumor for a period of two years, after which we carried out a total resection of the tumor under general anesthesia. Pathological diagnosis was osteoma of the tongue.
There were no signs of either recurrence or regrowth of the neoplastic lesion of the tongue for one year.
description.en:
A case of osseous choristoma of the tongue was reported. This disorder seems to be rare. The patient was a 14 year-old girl who had been referred to our clinic in June of 2000. For several years she had been aware of a small tumor in the dorsal of posterior of her tongue. However, the tumor had showed no other symptoms and no rapid growing. We diagnosed that it might be a benign tumor of the tongue. We continued to follow the tumor for a period of two years, after which we carried out a total resection of the tumor under general anesthesia. Pathological diagnosis was osteoma of the tongue.
There were no signs of either recurrence or regrowth of the neoplastic lesion of the tongue for one year.

paper_title.ja: 12歳男児の歯牙腫を伴った含歯性嚢胞の１例
paper_title.en: A Case of a Dentigerous Cyst with Odontoma in a 12-year-old boy

description.ja: We encountered a case of a dentigerous cyst with odontoma in a 12-year-old boy. The cyst included the crown of an impacted permanent tooth. Based on a clinical diagnosis of dentigerous cyst with odontoma, marsupialization under local anesthesia was performed. The odontoma was removed and the deciduous tooth was extracted to facilitate orthodontic treament. One year and two months after the operation, the impacted permanent tooth has completely erupted and is functioning normally.
description.en: We encountered a case of a dentigerous cyst with odontoma in a 12-year-old boy. The cyst included the crown of an impacted permanent tooth. Based on a clinical diagnosis of dentigerous cyst with odontoma, marsupialization under local anesthesia was performed. The odontoma was removed and the deciduous tooth was extracted to facilitate orthodontic treament. One year and two months after the operation, the impacted permanent tooth has completely erupted and is functioning normally.

paper_title.ja: 腫瘍性病変を疑わせた巨大な歯石沈着の１例
paper_title.en: A case of a giant dental calculus suspected to be a neoplastic lesion

description.ja:
A giant dental calculus suspected to be a neoplastic lesion is reported.
The patient was a 50-year-old woman. She had severe anemia caused by a uterine tumor.When she was treated for anemia at the hospital, an internist found an abnormal and extremely large hard mass in her mouth. She was referred to us for treatment of the lesion in her mouth after the transfusion therapy.
At presentation, we noticed that the patient had an extremely bad oral odor and poor oral hygiene. As for the giant mass of the oral floor, a neoplastic lesion was suspected because of its morphological features. The final diagnosis was a dental calculus on three-dimensional computed tomography, scintigraphy, and pathological biopsy.
The giant dental calculus was carefully removed, and the patient was instructed to maintain a sufficient level of oral hygiene to keep her mouth clean. The weight of the removed calculus was 30.5 grams. For 2 years 11 months, no redeposition of dental calculus has occurred.
description.en:
A giant dental calculus suspected to be a neoplastic lesion is reported.
The patient was a 50-year-old woman. She had severe anemia caused by a uterine tumor.When she was treated for anemia at the hospital, an internist found an abnormal and extremely large hard mass in her mouth. She was referred to us for treatment of the lesion in her mouth after the transfusion therapy.
At presentation, we noticed that the patient had an extremely bad oral odor and poor oral hygiene. As for the giant mass of the oral floor, a neoplastic lesion was suspected because of its morphological features. The final diagnosis was a dental calculus on three-dimensional computed tomography, scintigraphy, and pathological biopsy.
The giant dental calculus was carefully removed, and the patient was instructed to maintain a sufficient level of oral hygiene to keep her mouth clean. The weight of the removed calculus was 30.5 grams. For 2 years 11 months, no redeposition of dental calculus has occurred.

paper_title.ja: 新生児にみられた顎関節脱臼の１例
paper_title.en: A Case of Dislocation of the Temporomandibular Joint of a Newborn Male Baby

description.ja: We have reported a case of dislocation of the temporomandibular joint of a newborn male baby. He was referred to our clinic 2 days after his birth. The overhang of the left temporomandibular joint and the mandibular angle was found, and asymmetry of his face was seen since his birth. The diagnosis was a dislocation of the left temporomandibular joint. We and his pediatrician had decided to observe him without any treatments because he was too young to perform a surgical operation and also because he showed no clinical symptoms, such as the disturbance of feeding milk, dyspnea. The result around 4 months after the first examination, the left dislocation of the left temporomandibular joint was fixed spontaneously, and his temporomandibular joint functioned normally.
description.en: We have reported a case of dislocation of the temporomandibular joint of a newborn male baby. He was referred to our clinic 2 days after his birth. The overhang of the left temporomandibular joint and the mandibular angle was found, and asymmetry of his face was seen since his birth. The diagnosis was a dislocation of the left temporomandibular joint. We and his pediatrician had decided to observe him without any treatments because he was too young to perform a surgical operation and also because he showed no clinical symptoms, such as the disturbance of feeding milk, dyspnea. The result around 4 months after the first examination, the left dislocation of the left temporomandibular joint was fixed spontaneously, and his temporomandibular joint functioned normally.

paper_title.ja: ９歳女児の下顎骨に生じた好酸球肉芽腫の１例
paper_title.en: A Case of Eosinophilic Granuloma of the Mandible in a Nine-year-old Girl

description.ja:
The term Histiocytosis X was characterized by the histiocytic appearance of the cells. Three disease variants were included in this description: eosinophilic granuloma, Letterer-Siwe disease and Hand-Schüller-Christian syndrome. In 1985, a Philadelphia workshop on childhood histiocytosis changed the generic name of this collection to Langerhans cell histiocytosis, in recognition of the main proliferative component of the cellular population.
We reported a case of eosinophilic granuloma of the mandible in a 9- year old girl, who was referred to the mandible unit with an intermittent swelling of the right cheek. The radiography revealed a poorly defined radiolucent area in the right mandible. The tumor was removed under general anaesthesia via an intra-oral incision. Immunohistochemically the tumor cells showed strongly S100 protein positive. The Birbeck granules were found in the cytoplasm by electronmicrscope. The histological and immunohistological features were indicative of eosinophilic granuloma.
description.en:
The term Histiocytosis X was characterized by the histiocytic appearance of the cells. Three disease variants were included in this description: eosinophilic granuloma, Letterer-Siwe disease and Hand-Schüller-Christian syndrome. In 1985, a Philadelphia workshop on childhood histiocytosis changed the generic name of this collection to Langerhans cell histiocytosis, in recognition of the main proliferative component of the cellular population.
We reported a case of eosinophilic granuloma of the mandible in a 9- year old girl, who was referred to the mandible unit with an intermittent swelling of the right cheek. The radiography revealed a poorly defined radiolucent area in the right mandible. The tumor was removed under general anaesthesia via an intra-oral incision. Immunohistochemically the tumor cells showed strongly S100 protein positive. The Birbeck granules were found in the cytoplasm by electronmicrscope. The histological and immunohistological features were indicative of eosinophilic granuloma.

paper_title.ja: 極低体重児における先天性歯の1例
paper_title.en: A Case of Congenital Tooth of Very Low Birth Weight Infant

description.ja: We have reported a case of congenital teeth in a female infant with a very low birth weight (1, 020g). She was referred to our clinic 6 days after her birth. The mass was 5mm×7mm in size and was found at the lower alveolar region corresponding to the site of the left deciduous incisor. We thought the mass might be a congenital epulis at the lower gingiva. However, the tooth erupted from the top of the mass 22 days after the first medical examination. We diagnosed this as a congenital tooth and then removed both the granulation mass and tooth surgically under local anesthesia and intra venous sedation. Nine months has passed since the operation, and re-growth of the mass at the lower gingiva has not been observed. A dental diagnositc X ray showed that the congetital tooth was left at the deciduous first incisor. This confirmed that it was not a supernumerary tooth.
description.en: We have reported a case of congenital teeth in a female infant with a very low birth weight (1, 020g). She was referred to our clinic 6 days after her birth. The mass was 5mm×7mm in size and was found at the lower alveolar region corresponding to the site of the left deciduous incisor. We thought the mass might be a congenital epulis at the lower gingiva. However, the tooth erupted from the top of the mass 22 days after the first medical examination. We diagnosed this as a congenital tooth and then removed both the granulation mass and tooth surgically under local anesthesia and intra venous sedation. Nine months has passed since the operation, and re-growth of the mass at the lower gingiva has not been observed. A dental diagnositc X ray showed that the congetital tooth was left at the deciduous first incisor. This confirmed that it was not a supernumerary tooth.
